job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Accounting at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The Accounting team at Brex ensures we produce accurate and timely financial results to stakeholders to guide the business forward.&amp;nbsp; We go beyond closing the books — we automate, iterate, and improve processes in close collaboration with partners across the business. The team also serves as power users and thought leaders for Brex&#39;s own products. We bring precision and curiosity to everything we build, combining deep ownership with a product mindset to help shape the future of finance.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do &lt;/strong&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The Accounting Manager will play a key role in ensuring the integrity of our financial records and in developing scalable and sustainable processes as the business grows. In this role, you will be exposed to a variety of areas, primarily focusing on the accounting for Brex’s subsidiaries, which includes both regulated domestic and international entities. This work includes managing the accounting for our Bill Pay, Reimbursement and Repayment products, as well as intercompany transactions such as expense sharing and intercompany service revenue. Additionally, you will perform and implement key controls, and support the team through regulatory exams and audits. You will lead cross-functional work, partnering with our Banking Operations, System Engineers, Product and Compliance teams to complete these tasks and help drive the business forward. The Accounting Manager is expected to manage multiple priorities concurrently without compromising quality.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our San Francisco office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ownership of reconciliations for customer bill pay, reimbursement and repayment activity&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ownership of accounting for and calculation of outstanding transmission liability&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Monitoring compliance with applicable financial regulations such as capital requirements&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Preparation of financial statements and regulatory reports associated with the various entities&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Monthly calculation of intercompany expenses and revenues for various entities&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Leading reviews and analysis of assigned account groupings for month end close&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Supporting month end close with preparation of various journal entries and reconciliations&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Assisting with annual audits and recurring exams of regulated entities and assisting with the audit of Brex Inc&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Establishing accounting processes for new products that impact Brex and its subsidiaries&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identifying and delivering process improvements via cross functional collaboration&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Creating sustainable, repeatable and scalable processes&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identify key controls in the areas of ownership mentioned above and ensure process documentation is complete and accurate&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;College graduate with a 4-year degree in Accounting, Finance or a related field&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;4-6 years of public accounting or private industry experience&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and address difficult situations in a professional manner&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Innovative and able to provide “outside of the box” solutions&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Passion for having an owner’s mentality towards responsibilities and for career growth&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience implementing and improving business processes and systems&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong interpersonal skills and ability to manage deadlines effectively&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Effective verbal, listening, and written communication skills&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus Points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Relevant experience in accounting for broker dealers, international operations, and/or payment transmission activity&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Knowledge and experience using AI tools such as ChatGPT, Claude and/or Google Gemini&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Knowledge and experience using NetSuite, Looker, Numeric and/or other data visualization or automation software&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Licensed CPA&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $120,000- $155,000. However, the starting base pay will depend on several factors, including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Accounting Manager, Legal Entity Controllership

job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Implementation at Brex&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Implementation transforms new customers into power users. We lead the onboarding experience for companies adopting Brex Empower, helping them shift from outdated processes to a modern, employee-first approach. It’s a role that blends customer empathy, project management, technical expertise, process design, and change management. We take personal ownership of our customers&#39; long-term success, and we set customers up thoroughly so they can be with ‘Brex for life’. As strategic advisors, we build trust, drive solutions with tenacity, deliver results fast, and work cross-functionally to make adoption seamless for customers.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;As an Associate Technical Consultant, you are responsible for guiding and supporting Brex’s customers with any integration-related implementations. You’ll be responsible for solving and providing best practices for customers&#39; challenges related to Brex Integrations. You are also responsible for ensuring customers are equipped with the necessary integration knowledge of the Brex Platform to reduce friction and optimize the customer experience.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you’ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our Seattle office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Become a knowledgeable resource for our customers, guiding them on ERP architecture and business process flows with the support of the team.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Support customers through their implementation journey by joining calls to address integration matters and assist with escalations for systems like NetSuite, QuickBooks, and Sage Intacct.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Serve as a crucial link between customers and our internal teams, channeling valuable product feedback to help us build a better experience.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Engage closely with the broader Integration team, actively participating in knowledge sharing and continuous learning to build your expertise.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Collaborate with our Engineering, Product, and Design (EPD) partners to support the seamless rollout of new and updated integrations, ensuring our customers are set up for success.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;1+ years of experience in a customer-facing role, working with accounting systems (Quickbooks Online, Netsuite, Xero)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Basic functional knowledge in the following areas: General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Billing, Expense Management, HRIS&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Excellent communication skills, with an ability to explain the functionality and benefits of different integrations&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;A collaborative spirit and experience working with a team to solve problems.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong organizational skills with an ability to manage assigned tasks and a keenness to drive projects forward.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;A knack for problem-solving and the ability to recognize when to seek guidance from the team for more complex or technical issues.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $79,100 - $98,875.&amp;nbsp; However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Associate Technical Consultant

job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Sales at Brex&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;Sales is the growth engine at Brex. We bring in new customers, expand existing relationships, and drive the company’s bottom line. With unlimited territories and uncapped opportunity, your ambition sets the ceiling. We win together, celebrate often, and reward performance. If you want to sell a category-defining product with real ownership, this is your team.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;As a Banking Specialist on our newly formed Banking Team, you will have the opportunity to partner directly with Founders, Co-Founders, C-Suite Executives, VPs of Finance, and Controllers to continue generating net-new revenue by optimizing their adoption of our business account suite of products. As a foundational member of the team, you will work closely with our customers to upsell our checking, treasury, and sweep products to ultimately increase total AUM for Brex, a pivotal opportunity for Brex&#39;s overall growth.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;You will have the opportunity to work with all sizes of companies, ranging from small startups that are just starting to scale, all the way up to large mid-market and enterprise customers.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;This role will be based in our San Francisco or New York City office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;br&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Work with existing card only customers to upsell our business account suite of products (checking/treasury/sweep)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Assist in creating Security Account Control Agreements (SACA) or Cash Covenants to provide higher credit limits to our customers&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Become trusted account advisors by managing accounts and being strategic in both inbound and outbound sales&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Engage with businesses at all points of the sales cycle - including prospecting, product demonstrations, onboarding, and closing&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Develop strategic plans with cross-functional team members to drive adoption of our products, more AUM, and higher revenue for the company&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Focus on self-development with daily training and enablement&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Work closely with Account Executives, Relationship Managers, Customer Success, and Client Sales to bring in referrals&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;3+ years of outbound sales experience in financial services, fintech, or with early stage companies&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Excellent communication skills to drive conversations with Executive C-Suite decision makers&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience carrying quota and a proven track record of hitting and exceeding quotas&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;B.A or B.S degree from a 4-year university&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Series 7 &amp;amp; 63 license (active or able to be re-activated)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiarity with sales tools such as Gong, Salesforce, Outreach, etc.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;The expected OTE range for this role is USD $132,888 - $166,110. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. The OTE figure listed here includes base salary and commissions, which may or may not be earned depending on performance. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Banking Specialist

title: Banking Specialist

job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Sales at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The Sales team is the driving factor behind revenue for Brex and every member of our team directly affects our bottom line. We focus on generating new opportunities, acquiring new customers, and building even stronger relationships with our current customers. Our winning culture recognizes big team wins and celebrates individual accomplishments. We ensure that top performers are recognized and have built a competitive environment to motivate and unify the team.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;As a Commercial Account Executive, you’ll fuel Brex’s growth by winning net-new revenue from small to mid-sized businesses. In this high-volume, fast-paced role, you’ll prospect, build strong partnerships, and close deals by showing the unmatched value of Brex’s all-in-one Financial Operating System—Corporate Card, Expense Management, and Travel.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our San Francisco office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Full-Cycle Sales Execution: Own the end-to-end sales process from outbound prospecting to discovery, product demos, and closing deals.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Pipeline Generation &amp;amp; Management: Consistently source and qualify leads to maintain a strong, reliable pipeline.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Value-Based Selling: Clearly communicate ROI and business value by understanding each prospect&#39;s goals and aligning Brex’s solutions to their needs.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Customer-Centric Problem Solving: Build trust through insight and service, helping prospects navigate challenges and unlock growth.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Sales Development, Product, and Underwriting to create a smooth and impactful buyer experience.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;1+ years of closing experience in B2B SaaS sales, ideally in a high-volume or new business-focused role&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;A high-performing SDR/BDR background with a strong track record of sourcing and qualifying opportunities due to high self-prospecting requirements in role&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong ability to communicate value and ROI to small or mid-sized business stakeholders&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Consistent quota attainment and a history of top-tier performance&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;A proactive, self-motivated approach with a focus on results and customer impact&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiarity selling financial software (Expense Management, ERP, AP Automation, T&amp;amp;E, Accounting Software, Banking, etc.)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;div class=&quot;css-uyf4sz&quot;&gt; &lt;div class=&quot;css-tu9sm&quot;&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected OTE range for this role is $172,890 - $192,100. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. The OTE figure listed here includes base salary and commissions, which may or may not be earned depending on performance.&amp;nbsp; Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt; domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id=&quot;te-floating-button-container&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. title: Commercial Account Executive

job_city: New York, New York, United States
job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Sales at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The Sales team is the driving factor behind revenue for Brex and every member of our team directly affects our bottom line. We focus on generating new opportunities, acquiring new customers, and building even stronger relationships with our current customers. Our winning culture recognizes big team wins and celebrates individual accomplishments. We ensure that top performers are recognized and have built a competitive environment to motivate and unify the team.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;As a Commercial Account Executive, you’ll fuel Brex’s growth by winning net-new revenue from small to mid-sized businesses. In this high-volume, fast-paced role, you’ll prospect, build strong partnerships, and close deals by showing the unmatched value of Brex’s all-in-one Financial Operating System—Corporate Card, Expense Management, and Travel.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our New York City office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Full-Cycle Sales Execution: Own the end-to-end sales process from outbound prospecting to discovery, product demos, and closing deals.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Pipeline Generation &amp;amp; Management: Consistently source and qualify leads to maintain a strong, reliable pipeline.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Value-Based Selling: Clearly communicate ROI and business value by understanding each prospect&#39;s goals and aligning Brex’s solutions to their needs.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Customer-Centric Problem Solving: Build trust through insight and service, helping prospects navigate challenges and unlock growth.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Sales Development, Product, and Underwriting to create a smooth and impactful buyer experience.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;1+ years of closing experience in B2B SaaS sales, ideally in a high-volume or new business-focused role&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;A high-performing SDR/BDR background with a strong track record of sourcing and qualifying opportunities due to high self-prospecting requirements in role&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong ability to communicate value and ROI to small or mid-sized business stakeholders&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Consistent quota attainment and a history of top-tier performance&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;A proactive, self-motivated approach with a focus on results and customer impact&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bonus points&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Familiarity selling financial software (Expense Management, ERP, AP Automation, T&amp;amp;E, Accounting Software, Banking, etc.)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;div class=&quot;css-uyf4sz&quot;&gt; &lt;div class=&quot;css-tu9sm&quot;&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected OTE range for this role is $172,890 - $192,100. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. The OTE figure listed here includes base salary and commissions, which may or may not be earned depending on performance.&amp;nbsp; Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt; domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div id=&quot;te-floating-button-container&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

title: Commercial Account Executive

job_city: New York, New York, United States
job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compliance at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;The Compliance team helps the company grow responsibly, advocating for Brex and for the tens of thousands of growing businesses we serve. We own the compliance policies for Brex, provide strategic advice and guidance to all Brex teams, protect Brex from financial crime and other compliance risks, and represent the company externally on key regulatory and policy issues. Reimagining the financial system in a highly regulated environment requires creativity and resourcefulness, and we welcome the challenge.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;As a Compliance Manager at Brex, you will play a critical role in ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies regarding our products and services. The Product Compliance Manager, Cards &amp;amp; Rewards role will be responsible for ensuring the company&#39;s card products and operations comply with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations. This role will focus on maintaining a robust compliance program, monitoring regulatory changes, and providing guidance to internal stakeholders. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of financial regulations, strong analytical skills, and a commitment to maintaining the highest ethical standards. The role will report directly to the Compliance Manager, Payments &amp;amp; Card Compliance.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you’ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our New York City office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Advise on regulatory requirements for new and existing products and services, partnering with Product, Engineering, Operations, Legal, and other teams.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Stay abreast of all relevant regulatory changes impacting corporate charge card products, including but not limited to the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), Regulation B/ ECOA, escheatment, and other applicable laws and regulations.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Analyze and interpret new regulations, assessing their impact on the company&#39;s charge card operations.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identify and investigate potential compliance violations, including working with business owners to develop and implement corrective action plans, where appropriate.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Support audits, bank partner requests, and regulatory testing related to cards and rewards.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Develop and maintain all policies and procedures related to charge card regulatory compliance as well as card networks and bank partner requirements.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Review complaints related to cards and rewards and advise on resolution, including corrective action, where appropriate&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Qualifications:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;5+ years of experience in regulatory compliance, preferably in the financial services industry and fintech, with a focus on card issuing.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong understanding of federal and state regulations related to financial products, including TILA, ECOA, commercial finance disclosure laws, and other applicable laws and regulations.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Exceptional judgment and integrity, ability to handle complex matters independently, and product-minded approach to compliance.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to interpret and apply complex regulations.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Detail-oriented, accurate, organized, and able to set priorities&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to multi-task and adapt to shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong attention to detail and accuracy.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience with card processing systems and platforms.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Preferred Qualifications:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Relevant certifications (e.g., Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager (CRCM)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $159,000-$198,000 USD.&amp;nbsp; However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors, including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
title: Compliance Manager (Card & Rewards)
location: New York, New York, United States

job_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
job_description: &lt;div class=&quot;content-intro&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Why join us&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compliance at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;The Compliance team helps the company grow responsibly, advocating for Brex and for the tens of thousands of growing businesses we serve. We own the compliance policies for Brex, provide strategic advice and guidance to all Brex teams, protect Brex from financial crime and other compliance risks, and represent the company externally on key regulatory and policy issues. Reimagining the financial system in a highly regulated environment requires creativity and resourcefulness, and we welcome the challenge.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;As a Compliance Manager at Brex, you will play a critical role in ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies regarding our products and services. The Product Compliance Manager, Cards &amp;amp; Rewards role will be responsible for ensuring the company&#39;s card products and operations comply with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations. This role will focus on maintaining a robust compliance program, monitoring regulatory changes, and providing guidance to internal stakeholders. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of financial regulations, strong analytical skills, and a commitment to maintaining the highest ethical standards. The role will report directly to the Compliance Manager, Payments &amp;amp; Card Compliance.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you’ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our Salt Lake City office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&amp;nbsp;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Advise on regulatory requirements for new and existing products and services, partnering with Product, Engineering, Operations, Legal, and other teams.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Stay abreast of all relevant regulatory changes impacting corporate charge card products, including but not limited to the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), Regulation B/ ECOA, escheatment, and other applicable laws and regulations.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Analyze and interpret new regulations, assessing their impact on the company&#39;s charge card operations.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Identify and investigate potential compliance violations, including working with business owners to develop and implement corrective action plans, where appropriate.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Support audits, bank partner requests, and regulatory testing related to cards and rewards.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Develop and maintain all policies and procedures related to charge card regulatory compliance as well as card networks and bank partner requirements.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Review complaints related to cards and rewards and advise on resolution, including corrective action, where appropriate&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Qualifications:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;5+ years of experience in regulatory compliance, preferably in the financial services industry and fintech, with a focus on card issuing.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong understanding of federal and state regulations related to financial products, including TILA, ECOA, commercial finance disclosure laws, and other applicable laws and regulations.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Exceptional judgment and integrity, ability to handle complex matters independently, and product-minded approach to compliance.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to interpret and apply complex regulations.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Detail-oriented, accurate, organized, and able to set priorities&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Ability to multitask and adapt to shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Strong attention to detail and accuracy.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience with card processing systems and platforms.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Preferred Qualifications:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Relevant certifications (e.g., Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager (CRCM)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected salary range for this role is $136,000-$170,000 USD.&amp;nbsp; However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors, including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
